revised_title: Comparing Simultaneous Magnetic Disturbances and Gaussian Functions at Multiple Observatories
tldr: This article compares simultaneous magnetic disturbances at 17 different observatories, focusing on a significant magnetic storm that occurred on June 24 and 25, 1885. The author discusses the importance of adopting the same scale values for similar instruments at different observatories and presents tables of simultaneous disturbances, reduced to Greenwich mean time. The author also attempts to apply Gaussian analysis to sudden magnetic disturbances and provides the values of the Gaussian functions for 20 different observatories.
